jurls.reinforcementlearning.domains.arcade.rl

Class FeatureMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • jurls.reinforcementlearning.domains.arcade.rl.FeatureMap

  • public class FeatureMap
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple RL feature set for Atari agents. The screen is divided into blocks. Within each block, we encode the presence or absence of a color. The number of colors is restricted to reduce the number of active features.
    Author:
    Marc G. Bellemare

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int numColors
      The number of colors used in our feature set
      protected int numColumns
      The number of columns (y bins) in the quantization
      protected int numRows
      The number of rows (x bins) in the quantization

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FeatureMap() 
      FeatureMap(int columns, int rows, int colors)
      Create a new FeatureMap with fixed parameter settings: 16 columns, 21 rows and 8 colors (SECAM).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected static int encode(int color)
      SECAM encoding of colors; we end up with 8 possible colors.
      double[] getFeatures(FrameHistory history)
      Returns a quantized version of the last screen.
      int historyLength()
      Returns the length of history required to compute features.
      int numFeatures()
      Returns the number of features in this FeatureMap.
